title: The revival of an ancient form: Here’s why historical Chinese make-up is all the buzz right now
description: From slender, elongated eyebrows to forehead adornments known as hua dian, here’s why some beauty buffs of today are opting to eschew modern trends for anachronistic looksThe post The revival of an ancient form: Here’s why historical Chinese make-up is all the buzz right now appeared first on Vogue Singapore.

title: Erich von Däniken, Swiss writer who spawned alien archaeology, dies at 90
description: BERLIN (AP) — Erich von Däniken, the Swiss author whose bestselling books about the extraterrestrial origins of ancient civilizations brought him fame among paranormal enthusiasts and scorn from the scientific community, has died. He was 90.

title: Leaders of Korea, Japan hold summit in ancient capital of Nara
description: NARA — President Lee Jae Myung met with Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi in Nara prefecture on Tuesday afternoon for a bilateral summit, to be followed by an expanded session and a joint press conference. It was the third time the two leaders have met since Takaichi took office in October 2025, following a bilateral discussion on the sidelines of last year’s APEC summit in Gyeongju and a brief exchange at the G20 summit in South Africa. Nara holds special significance as the Japanese prime minister’s hometown and political constituency. Lee proposed meeting there during Takaichi’s visit to Gyeongju for the APEC summit last October. It is rare for a Japanese prime minister to invite a foreign head of state to their own electoral district and the meeting represents the first-ever summit between a Japanese prime minister and foreign leader in Nara. As the oldest of Japan’s former capital cities, Nara is also important as a symbolic site of historical exchange between Korea and Japan, reflecting cultural and diplomatic ties that date back more than 1,500 years. title: This one country has deserts, snowy mountains and ancient cities — and you can explore it all in one trip
description: Discover Uzbekistan, the one country where you can explore vast deserts, ancient Silk Road cities and snowy mountains in a single trip. From Samarkand to the Kyzylkum Desert and ski resorts near Tashkent, here’s why Uzbekistan is Central Asia’s most underrated travel destination.
